1512.content:
Order 66 hit the Jedi hard... very hard... countless Jedi lost their lives at the hands of Emperor Palpatine aka Darth Sidious, his apprentice the traitorous Anikan Skywalker now going by the title of Darth Varder, and the massive army of clone troopers.

Shaak Ti was one of the lucky ones to survive, she did so by a combination of another Jedi's sacrifice, and sheer luck.

She did not know the name of the Jedi that risked his life to save hers. He was a human male perhaps just barely out of the padawan stage in his training... because of this he didn't last long, but before Shaak Ti was to be gunned down by the 5 clone troopers marching behind her as she walked with them to the platform where her Delta-7 Aethersprite-class light interceptor was docked, she had intended to leave of the planet of Felucia to provide her fellow Jedi Aayla Secura with some much needed assistance and give orders to the clones behind her on how best to follow her ship, these were all dashed as her life was altered forever by what happened next, the unnamed Jedi jumped down onto the platform and killed one of the troopers with his blue lightsaber and yelled for her to run as they began to shoot at him.

Blocking most of the blaster bolts with his lightsaber he yelled incoherently about how the clone troopers were killing Jedi by the thousands, her Force Sense ability told her that he was not entirely lying, panicking she boarded her ship and left him behind as he was blasted dead by the troopers after he could no longer block their blaster bolts.

Shaak Ti flew by the Jedi temple on her way out of Coruscant's atmosphere, the sight of it on fire and sporadic explosions occurring on and in it told her he was telling the truth, from what she was able to sense of the turmoil inside she determined that there was nothing she could do, both because of the fact that it would be suicide and the fact that she now had 3 clone Z-95 starfighters on her tail as she fled.

Her sole advantage was that she knew that they intended to kill her as such she was able to destroy them after a very intense dogfight before she jumped into hyperspace bound for the outer rim.

Unfortunately Shaak Ti failed to notice that during said fight a stray blaster bolt had managed to damage the hydraulics line, the effect of this systems failure was not immediate but it accumulated as she spent the next 7 hours in hyperspace... wondering if anyone else was gonna survive Order 66; when her ship finally came out of hyperspace she found herself in orbit around an uncharted planet, not sensing the dark side on it she considered it a suitable candidate to hide but needed more information.

Sending a probe into it's atmosphere the information it sent back was rather... unusual, the planet's climate was very similar to Naboo, there was a breathable atmosphere, lots of open plains with unusually fertile soil for growing crops, scenic lakes and swamps that would be great for a hideout.

Shaak Ti detached her fighter from it's hyperspace ring and set course to enter the planet's atmosphere when the probe sent back more information that gave her pause. It detected that there was a civilization on the planet, the native race was primitive in comparison to galactic society and had apparently never been contacted by it before.

In terms of technological prowess they appeared to be in the midst of an industrial revolution, with most of their efforts focused on agriculture rather than transport to which they appeared to ship goods exclusively by boat.

This new information made Shaak Ti change her mind and attempt to leave the atmosphere to find a place where she wouldn't scare an uncontacted species with an unintentional 1st contact.

But when she tried to turn her ship up to leave the atmosphere the controls were jammed. It was only then did she notice the failure of the hydraulics system, she had no control and was unable to move her ship in any direction other than a straight line as she plummeted toward the planet's surface.

Shaak Ti was never studied engineering so even if she could fix the problem with the force she wouldn't know how to fix the the problem itself; all she could do was brace for impact with a Force Protect barrier around her body she deployed it when she was about 800 feet above the ground.

Placing all her power into the barrier she was able to survive the initial impact but skidding along the surface made her wane and caught her off guard, and lost consciousness after crashing into what appeared to be the local equivalent of a wheat field.

When Shaak Ti finally awoke she found herself being cared for by what appeared to be the locals. They were very curious beings indeed, in appearance they approximated a cross between blue Twi'leks and Kaminons.

Like the Kaminoans they had black eyes with white pupils, eyelids that closed vertically when they blinked, and were without noses apart from a pair of small vertical slits in their faces acting as nostrils, so they appear to have once been aquatic in their evolution, but like the Twi'leks they had what appeared to be Lekku on their heads, although they were much shorter than those found on Twi'leks and Togrutas like Shaak Ti's they still approximated such. remarkably they were located on different parts of the head for each gender. On the women (as Shaak Ti would later learn) the lekku number and length tended to vary but was always around 20 and only around 5 to 9 inches long on the back of their head, where as men always had 7 lekku on their jaw 3 on the sides and one on the chin never exceeding 3 inches in length to proximate a short beard. and aside from semi-webbed hands with 3 fingers and feet with the same number of toes, they had otherwise humanoid bodies, instead of scales, blue skin as smooth as those of Twi'lek women.

They were dressed in tribal looking outfits despite what the probe picked of of their society being a recent industrial one, apparently such clothes were common amongst the farmers of the planet. 1531.content:
An explosion rocked her A-Wing as she tries and fails to out maneuver the TIE fighter on her tail. “Phoenix Leader! Hera! Do you read?” A frantic voice faded in and out over her comms.

“I am alright Wedge. One of my stabilizes took a big hit.” She replied. “Chopper, see if you can’t rebalance the engines.”

“Hold on, I am doubling back for you.”

“Negative, Phoenix One, stat on mission. You must make sure those supplies reach their destination. I will be alright.”

“Understood.”

Hera let out a deep breath as another blast took out her engine as she angled her way to the closest planet. “Come on, back off.” She growled as her A-Wing shook violently. The TIE fighter broke off as her craft pitched and started rolling. “Chopper, hold on to something!” She cried as they rocketed through the cloud layer. They plunged into the tree line as Chopper shrieked in terror.

With a large CRASH!, the small fighter broke through the canopy and barreled into the swamp below.

“Uh, my head. Chop, you alright?” A series of unpleasant tones responded in kind. “Good, you hear. Can you flip on the backup power?” The auxiliary power flicked to live. “Comms are shot, so is the locater beacon. Maybe I can pull up the galactic map at least?” A light blue hologram sprung to light as creature several planets. “Dardonan, well Hutt Space is better than being in the Empire.”

She scrambled out of the cockpit as her astromech followed suit. Her boot sunk deep into the mud as the rain poured deep. “Chopper, see if you can patch the long-range transmitter.” She said as when to the storage compartment to check on they supplies.

‘Well at least the ration bars survived,” she muttered she wrapped a large, dense bar while tossing out some of the ruined supplies. She fined the task rather quickly and could only sit under the wing of her star fighter and hope someone would find her.

A low rumble soon appeared in the distance. Hera quickly jumps into a crouch and draws her pistol as Chopper stops his repairs to hide behind her. The low roar grew louder as spot lights soon joined them. Three large crude vessels flank her crash site as a fourth lands.

“Smuggers and slavers, fantastic.” She grumbles under her breathe as she drops her weapon. A large group of trandoshans and Gamorrean approach her. She raises her hand in submission as one of the lizard like Trandoshans grabs her and slaps on a pair of electo-cuffs. Another lunges at Chopper as the mech whirs in protest.

“Don’t hurt him!” She yells before turning as best she can to the astromech. “Just go with it.”

A Gamorrean prods her to move into the smugger’s vessel before turning to his boss as the two are herded to the ship.

“A gift of Jabba.” Was the captains only reply.

Pain.

Pain...was the only thing she felt at the moment.

As she drifted about in a Medical Bacta Tank within a Rebel Alliance outpost, the Twi'lek pilot of the Ghost, Hera Syndulla contemplated as to how she ended up in this position in the first place...

===Lothal===
==Lothal Sector==
==Outer Rim Territories==
==4 Hours Ago==

"Come on, Come on! Let's go!!"

Hers yelled out to her comrades, as they attempted to escape from a nearby Imperial Production Facility they just explicitly sabotaged.

And yet, unlike previous missions, something went wrong, as Kanan and Ezra were losing their footing against another of the dreaded Inquisitors; A hulking female Dowutin known only as "The Ninth Sister".

Kanan and Ezra were losing the battle, as they were put on the defensive against the Inquisitor behemoth, while Seb and Sabine tried to assist them with long range blaster fire, but to no avail.

But moments after recovering from a swift Force Push from Kanan, the Ninth Sister soon showed a sneering grin, letting out a brief chuckle as well.

"What's so funny?" Ezra growled, only to witness as the Ninth Sister swiftly thrusted out her unarmed hand, her fingers positioned in a Dark Side Force attack.

Only...it wasn't aimed at neither Kanan or himself.

Soon, Hera quickly felt as if her insides were being crushed from within, causing her to let out a painful shriek!

"HERA!!" Kanan roared, realizing what the Ninth Sister was doing, and on instinct, he swung his lightsaber towards the Ninth Sister, which ultimately resulted in the Inquisitor losing a sizeable portion of her arm in the process!

And with haste, the group swiftly made their exit from the area. However, upon reaching the ship's bridge, they found Hera lying on the metallic floor in excruciating pain, clinging to her stomach region with a pained expression on her face, while Seb took her place at the helm for the time being.

Nonetheless, the Ghost crew was dealt a serious blow...

===Rebel Outpost O-122-D7===
==Oon==
==Lothal Sector==
==Outer Rim Territories==
==Present Day==

Despite the reasonable request from the medics that she should be left to recover, Kanan couldn't help himself with accepting this.

And as he sat on a nearby stool, twiddling his thumbs, he felt as if he had failed to protect Hera from such an adversary, as the guilt felt a little too unbearable to comprehend.

After all, he was starting to have affectionate feelings toward the Twi'lek pilot. And yet, whilst he swam through his personal thoughts...

15511.content:
Within a dark room, a heavy groan sounded out. Deep within the shadows, a bed could almost be made out with a feminine body resting atop. An arm reached out, and a small click could be heard before recessed lighting around the room faded up, slowly casting the darkness back and revealing the room. The female occupant was a blue skinned Twi’lek called Aayla Secura, former Jedi Knight and General in the Republic’s army of clones. All of that was far behind her though. Her rapid downward trek began with Order 66, a command sent out to the clone army to exterminate all Jedi. She barely managed to save herself from the clones she was traveling with, and fled into the galaxy. Upon hearing the warning Obi-wan sent out, she had gone into hiding, never staying in one spot for too long, and avoiding the agents of the Empire as any remaining Jedi were hunted down.

She ended up attracting too much attention though when she was trying to earn some extra credits by making use of the standard way of thinking when it came to female Twi’leks: she was up on stage in some crummy little bar on a tiny Outer Rim world, dancing the night away as she had been for a time, when someone took quite a shine to her. It was when she went backstage that she found out that the scuzzball Rodian owner of the bar had ended up selling her into slavery to her “fan”. Before she could react, a few thugs jumped her. Unwilling to use her force abilities, and because of their surprise attack, she was quickly subdued, though she didn’t go down without a fight, inflicting a number of injures on her attackers. It was all for naught though, as they drugged her and she lapsed into unconsciousness. When she awoke, she was transported to wherever she was now, and fitted with a new accessory: a slave collar locked around her neck, preventing any escape.

They also kept her drugged with some narcotic, some form of the drug spice she thought, though like none she had ever encountered or known before. It kept her mind hazy and slightly unfocused, not enough that she couldn’t think well, but certainly enough to keep her from using her force abilities. She didn’t even think that her owner – a thought that brought a grimace to her face – even knew of her force abilities, or her former status as a Jedi, the drug was likely just being used to help restrain her and keep her a bit more submissive. It also had the odd side effect of leaving her with a ravenous hunger, so that no matter how much she tried fighting, she regularly performed feats of gluttony she had only known Hutts to do. The drug also tended to make her lazier, so that no amount of willpower could stir her to even think about exercising, let alone actually doing so. The excessive food intake combined with a lack of action – not counting the regular times when she was made to dance for her master – combined to fatten the formerly slender and athletic woman.

Another groan escaped her throat, as she barely overcame her inertia and forced herself out of bed. Casting a glance around her prison, she found nothing unchanged: the room was still fabulously decorated, with furniture and pieces of art that wouldn’t have looked out of place in a palace or museum. She still often found herself amazed at such obvious wealth being spent decorating even a slave’s room. A huge curving window dominated the far side of the room, and became transparent as it responded to her awakening, revealing the crowns of trees forming a lush forest stretching as far as she could see, even climbing the sides of the mountains in the distance, the pale disk of the small red sun cresting the peaks. After several attempts, she found that the window was reinforced, preventing any chance of escaping there. She also knew that despite the appearance of paradise stretched out before her, ferocious beasts stalked the forest and flew through the skies of this world, making escape an even less likely prospect.

Stirring into motion again, she walked across the plush carpeting, heading towards the connected bathroom, the sheer negligee hugging her body and swishing lightly. She would rather have worn something a bit more practical, but her “master” only stocked such “sexy” clothing, almost always in sizes too small as her body continued to fatten out. Entering the bathroom, the lights automatically responded to her presence, starting out low but becoming ever brighter till the shadows were banished from the similarly richly furnished bathroom. Discarding the nightgown, she walked up to a full length mirror, a sneer crossing her face as she looked at how her body had changed recently. A small holographic display appeared within her field of view, as some hidden computer system scanned her and displayed relevant information. 155321.content:
With a roar and a grunt, the wookie unceremoniously tossed the captain down the chute. She attempted to latch onto the the sides of the metal duct, but could barely slow her descent as she tumbled downwards, banging on the sides of the wall. "Like music to my ears..." she heard her insubordinate's voice echo down, "Clean that mess up, Phasma!" he jeered. She wanted to yell back, but the clanging kept knocking the wind out of her as she tumbled faster. Her mind reeled with fury, replaced by fear as she thought about where she could end up. She could end up in a blast furnace, or even just fall into the planet's core.

Her fears we answer as she belly flopped into the wet mass of garbage and refuse. "FN.....21...87...." she growled, standing up and sinking knee deep in filth, the odor wafting into her helmet, the filters keeping it non lethal but failing to stop the unpleasantness. With trudging motion, she waded through the waste, towards the dull red light, hoping for a door.

She felt around the wall, unable to see very well, and her helmet damaged by the fall, knocking out any scopes she might have. The red light began to grow in intensity, and a siren blared. Whatever pretense of calm Phasma had searching for an escape turned to frantic desperation as she banged on the walls, yelling out for her troop. The red light became blinding, and the cesspool water began to quiver. The siren halted, the light went dim, and the quaking stopped. She could only freeze and sweat ad everything went calm. With a pop, the entire floor dropped, and Phasma was falling again.

After a few seconds of being tossed about like a salad and being thoroughly plastered with trash, she felt herself fall into a greater pile. This time, she was outside in the landfill. She stood up slowly, snow gathering on her scuffed and dirtied armor. She heard explosions in the distance, and turned to see the resistance bombing the facilities sparse weak points. "FN 2817!" she growled again, knowing he had sold them out, and knew just what would happen when the base tried to fire with that part destroyed. Regrouping was out of the question, the planet was going to be fried. She trudged out of the landfill, ignoring the cold and ditching her cape.

She found a transport ship abandon, and immediately. As she was taking off, the planet was shaking, entering the death throws. She paused for a second, eyeing the scanner for stragglers to carry off planet, hovering dangerously closing to the collapsing crust. And explosion ruptured the ground below, and sent magma sputtering into the ships, launching it into orbit. For the third time, she was helplessly flung, bouncing against the ships interior as it was flung recklessly into space. This meant the crowds were almost as thick as they had been earlier today. Mission was trying to remain off of the streets though. There were too many prying eyes that might belong to someone looking for her. Readjusting the poncho that covered her combat suit, the Twi’lek turned away from the light and resumed her journey further down the alley. She kept a hand on the concealed blaster pistol resting at her hip, hoping she wouldn’t need to use it but fearing she would.

It was supposed to have been a simple job. She was just the slicer for a team breaking into one of the old abandoned Sith bases. How was she supposed to know that the defense system was left on standby waiting for the power to be turned back on? It wasn’t like she could get any readings before she had reactivated the core and everything turned into a shooting gallery. She managed to shut the auto-turrets down, but not before half of the team ended up fried even through their armor. Those Sith blaster turrets seemed to be a lot stronger than any she had run across during her time with Reven.

She sighed wistfully as she thought back to that grand adventure to save the Republic from Malak years before. She was kind of wishing she had some of the old team as backup right now, especially Big Z. The Wookie’s strength would really have come in handy right about now. Mission regretted having to leave him behind, but it couldn’t have been helped, the big guy wasn’t exactly known for his stealth after all.

She paused under a small awning in the next alleyway and pulled out her datapad. If she was reading the map right, she would be able to get to the spaceport soon and leave this planet behind. She was glad that she had been able to disable the tracker than had been part of the comlink for this job, or she would never have gotten away. Stowing her pad again, she dashed back out into the rain, splashing through the puddles as she ran for her destination.

The walls of the spaceport were in sight when a clatter and a shout behind her made her stop and turn. Drawing the blaster, she was suddenly pounced on from behind. With a shout, she tried to turn the blaster on her attacker, but they shoved her hard against the wall, forcing the breath from her lungs. Whoever it was then bashed her hand against the wall several times till the blaster dropped to the ground with a clatter. A metallic rasp and a sudden pressure locking around her wrist was the only warning she got before one hand and then the next were bound with binders. Only then was she forced to turn around.

Standing around her, the lot of them looking rather drenched, were some of the surviving members of the team she had been part of. Waiting in the back was a Weequay sporting a rather nasty burn across one side of his leathery face.

“Jiblak,” Mission said with as much pleasantry as she could force as she got her breath back. “I was hoping you were going to survive that unfortunate accident back there. But you see, I’m running late for another job, so if you would let me go—“

“Quiet!” he barked, and looking like he was barely able to hold back from punching her. “That ‘accident’ has the boss angrier than me, so you’re coming with us,” he said in the usual heavy accented basic common to Weequay.

“The boss?” she repeated with a bit of panic. “There’s no need for that, right guys?” putting on the best smile she could, curling her lips as she looked back and forth at some of the others. “You guys still made off with plenty of loot from that base, and it turns out I don’t need the pay for this job, so we’re all good right?”

In response, Jiblak did hit her this time. A sucker punch to the stomach caused her to double over and causing what breath she had to escape again. The leader gave a quick command to the others before setting off. The rest followed the Weequay, dragging the still struggling Twi’lek along the way. They soon made it to a waiting vehicle, and everyone bundled in. Mission was shoved to the floor with several walls of meat just waiting for her to make a move. Despite her position, she was able to get a feel for what direction they were going.
155322322121.title: On the run
